kernfrasen: Death is swallowed up in victory
seek the living among the dead
movement in the direction of death
look away from the old world
turn away from death toward the source
you don't own your possessions; they own you

cognitieve_implicaties: Death is not a natural friend
onbedoelde_consequenties: May foster a combative stance toward the dying process

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the 'Enemy' metaphor by explicitly rejecting the 'death is natural' (dead metaphor) modern schema.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The sermon maintains a strong tension between human attempts at 'control' (Source: Management/Mechanics) and God's 'victory' (Source: Military). The coherence is found in the consistent rejection of the 'Death as a Fixable Problem' schema.

incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: If faith is a pure gift that cannot be 'bought' or 'found,' the transition to it being a tool for 'empowerment' creates a slight logical gap between passivity and agency.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: Gift entails lack of effort; Empowerment entails capacity for action.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The preacher blends modern vanity (cosmetic surgery) with ancient ritual (spices) to create a single schema of 'Human Futility in the face of Decay.'

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-activates the 'Enemy' status of death against modern therapeutic reductions.
sterktes.voorbeeld: Death is ugly, bald, miserable... the last Enemy.

risicos.beschrijving: The military metaphor of 'victory' might lead some to ignore the reality of physical suffering.
risicos.voorbeeld: The King of heaven... o'er death and hell rose triumphing.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregants may feel they lack faith if they feel 'defeated' by grief.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: The Empty Tomb as a site of mystery and 'un-control'.
sub_worlds: The political world of violence (NRA, prisons, immigration)
The hospital room of the dying friend

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Highly effective in grounding the abstract 'seeking living among dead' in concrete vanity.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: By emphasizing that the Resurrection was 'out of our range of understanding' and 'from another sphere.'

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Using visceral language ('ugly, bald') and quoting Flannery O'Connor to disrupt 'feeling OK about death.'
verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: Death as an Invader/Enemy that only God can defeat.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly aligns with the 'Burial Office' and Easter liturgy.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by a 'Control vs. Transcendence' dialectic. It successfully uses the Military domain (Victory/Enemy) to provide hope while using the Economic/Mechanical domains (Fixing/Buying/Industry) to critique human hubris. The landscape is rugged and anti-sentimental.

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Deepen the 'Source' by describing the physical 'un-fixing' of the world.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The Resurrection is the cosmic jailbreak from the prison of entropy.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The shift from 'Faith as Gift' to 'Faith as Empowerment'.
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Use the 'Container' metaphor: Being 'in' the Risen Christ provides the power, rather than faith being a battery the believer possesses.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: If it can't be fixed, we are helpless victims.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Ensure the 'Victory' metaphor emphasizes that the 'fixing' was done by God, not that the 'brokenness' is the final word.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To describe the 'other sphere of reality' as a new building or foundation.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful use of CMT to deconstruct modern secular schemas of death and replace them with a robust, Pauline theology of Resurrection.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: While an aesthetic analysis would praise the 'vivid imagery' of the caskets, CMT reveals these are cognitive tools used to map the concept of 'Futility.'
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's experiential learning cycles, CMT shows how the preacher re-wires the hearer's neural mapping of 'Death' from 'Natural' to 'Enemy.'
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies the 'Control' metaphor as the primary source of modern anxiety, which the preacher systematically replaces with 'Trust in Transcendent Power.'

appendices.notities: The preacher uses a 'Container' metaphor implicitly when discussing 'another sphere of reality'â€”the Resurrection happens 'outside' our world-container.
